Description: A conical pendant of lapis lazuli: with flat, circular base and a blunted point. The upper and lower surfaces are slightly flattened. Pierced for suspension.
Curator's comments: The date is quite uncertain: this pendant is most closely paralleled in shape by a predynastic bead in A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’, Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Mitteilungen aus der ägyptischen Sammlung’ V (Berlin, 1931), 107, form 5, right, but unlike the bead the pendant is pierced through its pointed end, not its length. The only comparable published pendant is a blue glazed composition example on a string from Mostagedda dated to the Fourth Dynasty, see pendants (1929,1015.619).
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (145)
